page.title: 06Pagan's Hill, Chew Stoke
page.content: Sweeping down towards the main road Pagan's Hill marks a place where Romans trod but now sledges ride. Everyone knows Pagan's Hill - it's a sort of landmark of the village of Chew Stoke. It makes me feel proud that our name is mentioned because of Pagan's Hill "the site where Romans once civilized". It's funny to think that where thousands of years ago Romans were civilizing and walking on the same ground as you are walking on. It is their hill its the Pagan's Hill. When lakes are frozen, and gardens bleak Pagan's Hill is alive with people, sledges for two, or even trays that send you spinning, high jumps, human fliers, plastic bombers and snowball fights. Pagan's Hill will always be an important memory for me.
